title: Drawing, "Sketches from Jamaica, West Indies", June 1865
medium:
Recto: Graphite on gray paper
Verso: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper
inscribed:
Recto:   Inscribed in graphite, at center:  2  ; and explained, at bottom right:  2 Rich luminous / orange blossoms / splendid effect of color ; again at right center:  3 ; and written underneath:  3 delicate green leaf which appeared / in beautiful contrast / to the brilliant   orange / blossoms ; and finally with place and date at bottom left.

Verso:  Inscribed in graphite:  luminous ; and again:  view from / Hamstead
description:
Recto: Horizontal view showing:  distant view of four women, three of whom carry loads upon their heads, of a seated person and some indistinct objects at top left; a walking man seen from the back at top right; a palm tree at center; a woman carrying a load upon her hat seen from the back at left center; a child, a half figure, a detail of the palm at right center.

Verso: landscape seen horizontally showing the sky with some clouds over moutain ranges and the sea.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches from Jamaica, West Indies", June 1865.
June 1865. Recto: Graphite on gray paper
Verso: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-19.
